byline.original: By ILEANA NAJARRO and STEPHANIE CLIFFORD

abstract: Document filed by prosecution in case of New York City Police Officer Peter Liang, who is charged with second-degree manslaughter for shooting of Akai Gurley in Brooklyn housing project, states that Liang and his partner Shaun Landau did not attempt to help Gurley after he had been shot, but walked around body and down stairwell.
lead_paragraph: After a ricocheting bullet from Peter Liang’s gun struck Akai Gurley, he and his partner failed to aid the victim, a newly unsealed document charges.

headline.main: Prosecutors Say Officer Didn’t Help Man He Shot in Brooklyn Stairwell
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Say Officer Didn’t Help Unarmed Man He Shot in a Brooklyn Stairwell

snippet: After a ricocheting bullet from Peter Liang’s gun struck Akai Gurley, he and his partner failed to aid the victim, a newly unsealed document charges.

keywords.value: Landau, Shaun (New York City Police Officer)
keywords.name: persons
